website_summaries.verdict: This affordable weight loss cookbook goes above and beyond merely listing healthier recipes by explaining the benefits of clean eating and how to achieve your dietary goals.
pros: Examples include sea scallops, butternut squash pancakes, and carrot salad

customer_reviews.title: The writer of this book goes in to great detail about ups and downs of sugar and binge ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was looking for a few more recipes. The writer of this book goes in to great detail about ups and downs of sugar and binge eating, etc., but in all honesty I felt it was overkill and I was looking more for recipes which there are quite a few in the book. I mean it's not the worst book out there and it's certainly armed with an array of information.
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: No Pictures But Solid Book
customer_reviews.text: Fair warning, this book does not have pictures. That’s kind of a huge thing for me and I would have otherwise not bought this book if I knew. But now I have it and there is some solid information in here. All the recipes seem simple and easy enough. They don’t require any crazy ingredients which is important for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little cookbook with good information, but the information isn't anything you couldn't already find online or in a magazine of the same scope. For me personally, my biggest frustration with the recipes is that there seem to be so many nightshade vegetables needed to fulfill them. I realize I can just leave those out or try to substitute, but honestly the majority of the recipes would then be pointless without them. I might pick it up for something here and there but it will probably collect dust on my cookbook shelve. I would've returned it but it's too late now.
customer_reviews.author: RMC

customer_reviews.title: The recipes are impressive
customer_reviews.text: Only saw one questionable recipe, Turkey split pea soup, add the Turkey at the end and heat through, no where does it say to cook the Turkey first and this should be done to prevent any raw meat in the soup. Will be trying a lot of these recipes. Wish there were more for two servings rather than 6 to 8 but I will adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: klove

customer_reviews.title: Natural Food Plan For Real People With Real Appetites
customer_reviews.text: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet takes the ideas of the natural food revolution of the 1960s and forms it into a practical easy to use format for healthy living. The book teaches how to choose foods as close to their natural state as possible. A plan of moderate exercise, small meals (5 to 6 times a day), and a commitment to healthy eating shows how to make a reasonable compromise with research presently available. It gives Superfoods, processes to use, a delightful two week menu plan, and 105 recipes. A handy list of Internet resources offers more information if so desired. It has an honest open conversational tone that lets you decide what is best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J Page

customer_reviews.title: Great book!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of this book! Gives great background of what to eat, stay away from and breaks down the food categories in a simple way. There are some great recipes to try too. I actually bought it again for someone as a gift. Definitely recommend for anyone looking for direction on changing their eating habits to a clean and non-processed diet. I lost 12 pounds over a few months of following these principles along with exercise.
customer_reviews.author: VicNic

customer_reviews.title: TONS of sugar!
customer_reviews.text: All of these recipes are LOADED with sugar. Honey, maple syrup, blended fruit, those are still going to give you massive sugar spikes even if they aren't refined white sugar. The recipes do look good, and they are better than a lot that's out there, but don't fool yourself into thinking these recipes are healthy. Be cognizant and do your own substitutions. I was hoping for more instructions on making food that tastes good without feeding the American sugar addiction.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: They do not use whole eggs (only egg whites) what good is that and is not gluten free
customer_reviews.text: While the recipes are whole food recipes they include ingredients that I do not consider nutritional. Processed oils for one example. They do not use whole eggs (only egg whites) what good is that and is not gluten free. I would return if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Corcorran

customer_reviews.title: I just love this recipe book
customer_reviews.text: I just love this recipe book. It shows how to eat healthy. I am tired of eating junk food all the time and wanted to eat healthy. The book explains step by step how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Van Zyl

customer_reviews.title: Great overview and yummy recipes
customer_reviews.text: Have you heard about clean eating? Wondered how to get started? This book will help. The Clean Eating Cookbook and Diet starts with a short but detailed history of clean eating and the principles behind it. Clean eating is consuming food in a form as close to natural as possible. There is a fourteen day eating plan that gives examples of how to structure your meals . It has extensive lists of proper foods and spices to use. Super food combinations that improve the nutritional benefits is a nice touch. The recipes makeup most of the book. I tried the Baked Apples and they were very tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: No pictures, good recipes. More informational than actual cookbook
customer_reviews.text: No pictures. It's a great book with a LOT of information on eating clean. I'm a pretty good home cook, but I still like to see what I'm making. This is great as an information how-to and there are actually really great recipes, even for kids and can be made in larger quantities for bigger families. I gave it 3 stars for the no pictures.
customer_reviews.author: HK

customer_reviews.title: It has a few good ideas for recipes (most are pretty lengthy) and some ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay book. It has a few good ideas for recipes (most are pretty lengthy) and some basic information about clean eating. It's a good beginners book for eating healthy.
customer_reviews.author: ABowl

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. Pretty and streamlined. The perfect motivation for healthy eating without being overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: biancap

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Whole Food Recipes - Easy to Follow
customer_reviews.text: The fundamentals of clean eating, Do’s and Don’ts, and 105 very easy-to-follow recipes make this book an excellent guide. The organized chapters helped me find what I was looking for. Each recipe has an introduction containing special information about the benefits such as a super food. The recipes were all in capital letters which made them a bit hard to read. I printed out the food list in the Appendix so I could take it with me when I went shopping. The Glossary defined some terms that I did not understand before.
customer_reviews.author: Legs

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great book! If you're looking to feel better over all not even just to lose weight this is the book
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Packed with info and great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book packed with information on how to get into the Clean Eating lifestyle. It was great to read about all the benefits of clean eating and to have all the recipes in one book. I loved the shopping lists and meal plans, as well as all the information included in each recipe such as what season the recipe is best for, if it contains super foods, if it is low fat or budget friendly. Overall a great book promoting a way of eating that I could definitely get used to. Can't wait to start throwing away my junk food and getting on the road to better health with the recipes and information in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Evergreen Terri

customer_reviews.title: Complete Explanation of Clean Eating with Delicious Recipes
customer_reviews.text: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet: Over 100 Healthy Whole Food Recipes & Meal Plans is the most complete guide available to explain the newly popular lifestyle of clean eating. The book explains that this is not a diet, but a lifestyle to get rid of processed foods and eat food in its’ natural state. The book goes further to explain the health benefits of clean eating along. The best part is that the book provides a two week meal plan with a shopping list to get started. It also contains 105 clean eating recipes. This book is THE book to buy to begin a cleaner, healthier lifestyle for any family.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great primer for those interested in creating a healthier relationship ...
customer_reviews.text: Great primer for those interested in creating a healthier relationship with food. Shopping lists, menus, and dos and don'ts. I wouldn't call it a diet but a lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Madden

customer_reviews.title: A Better Way of Eating
customer_reviews.text: Jump start this new year with a healthy new lifestyle! The Clean Diet offers nutritionally dense foods that are chock-full of vitamins and minerals to boost your energy and to get you on a path to a more wholesome way of eating. This book has educational sections on ideal food choices like flour, grains and spices along with their health benefits, plenty of meal options, helpful tips on different cooking techniques, and a shopping list and menu plan for 14 days to help you get started. However, the shopping lists may stretch your budget, and more time may be required for these daily meal preparations.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: This is a very quick read with lots of good info. The recipes are tasty and simple to make!
customer_reviews.author: LAMH

customer_reviews.title: I like how Dr
customer_reviews.text: I learned a lot from Dr. Alejandro Junger with his own description and explanation of the different parts of the intestine. I had no idea how important the gut was. I didn't know the role and the communication that is played between the intestinal flora and the cells inside the guts. I like how Dr. A. J. explained our 2 brains: in the head and in the gut. I am doing the 21 days Clean Gut Repair. I cheated, though, but still, after 17 days, I feel I've improved my health and my attitude toward life.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole PAVILES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: No matter your reason for using this book, be it health, environment, or both, this cookbook is awesome! Not only do you get clean recipes, you get the science behind using them. This is a must have for someone looking to wean themselves or their family members off of processed garbage and back to a diet more like our grandparents ate.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great Guide to Clean Eating
customer_reviews.text: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet: Over 100 Healthy Whole Food Recipes & Meal Plans is a comprehensive guide to eating healthy and enjoying it every step of the way. Not only does this book help you lean to cook, it explains what ‘clean eating’ means and the benefits of what doing so can be. By reading this book I have learned the dos and don’ts of clean eating, how to get started, how to incorporate exercise, and most importantly, cooking! From green smoothies and omelets to cookies and pasta dishes, there is something for everyone’s taste. I would definitely recommend this book for anyone wanting to change his or her diet for the better.
customer_reviews.author: MKCrawford

customer_reviews.title: Great diet book. Higly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of the book is wonderfully straightforward - to explain a cleaner mode of eating. It combines principles like eating locally sourced food, seasonal food and combining other food combinations to turn your kitchen into both a seasonal garden and an apothecary. I found the flour conversion chart especially useful, as my youngest has allergies related to a lot of purchased baked goods. I was pretty surprised, but I’ve found this to be one of my go-to-resources in the kitchen, and when cutting coupons on Sunday night. I am hoping that in future editions that they discuss some alternate protein sources. 9/10 Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G Godwin

customer_reviews.title: The title says it all.
customer_reviews.text: There are so many mixed messages out there so that’s why this book caught my eye. Its message is simple – it’s a lifestyle, not a fad. The author is also quick to point out that no one is perfect so even if you incorporate a few changes, it’s better than none. I found the “why’s” of choosing what to eat, when to eat and how to prepare the food very helpful. The 14 day plan and shopping list takes the guess work out of getting started, especially if this is all new to you. The book is easy to read and offers lots of healthy suggestions and alternatives to make the switch to clean living.
customer_reviews.author: L Cove

customer_reviews.title: Spirolina Green Algae in a Smoothie...
customer_reviews.text: I really love this book. Fresh fruits and vegetables, all local and in season, plenty of whole grains, along with lean cuts of meat, wild-caught fish, and organic eggs and dairy are essential. The basic message is to avoid over processed foods with ingredients you don’t understand. If you can’t pronounce it, don’t eat it. I especially liked the smoothies like the Green Energy Smoothie with spirulina green algae, the Irish Bean and Cabbage Soup, and the really healthy twist on Jambalaya with brown rice. The Grilled Pineapple with Cinnamon Yogurt Sauces is absolutely to die for. Can you tell I’m hungry now?
customer_reviews.author: Kat McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Probably won't use a lot of the recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Probably not a lot in here I will actually use; however it's a nice book and printed well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book may be better suited for those already eating clean and need a ...
customer_reviews.text: Zero pictures -kind of a bummer. The recipes look alright, but not very inspirational. I think I was hoping for a jump start into cleaner eating, a cookbook that made me say, "yeah, this looks delicious and healthy! I'm on board the clean-eating train." Or whatever. This book may be better suited for those already eating clean and need a few recipe ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Book with a positive message.
customer_reviews.text: This book is very inspiring. The book discusses how important it is to “ditch” foods that are processed in order to take up clean eating. The book stresses that clean eating is a lifestyle, not a diet, which is noteworthy. Included are 105 recipes that look yummy plus a well-organized 2-week meal plan and shopping list. It seems that if someone made the effort to following the Clean Eating Cookbook and Diet plan, they would lose weight naturally while their health would improve. It’s certainly worth a read.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Intensive Guide to a New Lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: This book is more than just a cookbook. It’s a lifestyle guide. Clean Eating, which is eliminating negative things from your diet, such as processed foods, refined sugar, trans and saturated fats, etc. Instead, you fill your diet with things such as whole grains, vegetables, and good fats. Most importantly, this book is your guide through the lifestyle. With more than just recipes, it explains what foods go well together, for when you would like to make your own meals or snacks. It also explains different ways of cooking and preparing your food so that you can make more than just the recipes in the book. This book is your complete guide to clean eating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Book with Great Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! It has so many great recipes and they are easy to make! I use this all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well organized, crisp format, and easy to follow!
customer_reviews.text: I love the shopping lists for the 14-day meal plan and how most of the recipes seem to be "Quick & Easy." It's great that the recipes are also flagged for the most applicable season of the year. The flour substitution chart is awesome and I especially appreciate the whole chapter on Clean Cooking! Funny...I just realized that this book isn't loaded with amazing photos of perfectly-cooked and perfectly-staged dishes...It doesn't need them!
customer_reviews.author: JJK

customer_reviews.title: Good ideas
customer_reviews.text: I will try a few of these recipes over the next few weeks. The information about clean eating is helpful. It gives a good explanation of why and how to eat clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best laid out plan to change your health and eating
customer_reviews.text: I m trying to change my diet to improve my health. This book is designed, has recipes easy affordable and things you may have already, plus best part directions to get you there, just not throw you out and let you figure it out, there is easy to follow directions and week menus and little changes each week.
customer_reviews.author: Leeora

customer_reviews.title: Jumpstart a Healthy Lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is more than just a cookbook - it teaches you what “clean eating” actually is and provides an in depth look about how to maintain a healthy lifestyle without succumbing to fad diets. Reading through the research and history of clean eating helped me understand how certain foods promote general well-being and how other foods influence poor eating habits and unhealthy cycles. The comprehensive lists of lean proteins, super foods, complex carbs, and of course what to cut from your diet helps build a strong basis to staying on track with clean eating. This book provides a holistic foundation for jumpstarting an active lifestyle - soon it just become second nature.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Yuan

customer_reviews.title: Good book.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good book that covers the basics of cleat eating. The recipes are really good.
customer_reviews.author: Fool for Christ

customer_reviews.title: Best Clean Eating Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: A quick and informative read. Making the suggested changes in our diet could have a huge impact in fighting serious and potentially deadly ailments, such as asthma, diabetes, food allergies, arthritis, and cardiovascular disease. Common sense prevails in the list of non inflammatory food choices and which foods to avoid. Readers are provided with questions and answers about reducing inflammation and advice on how to attain successful change. The meal plans are pretty simple and the 100 recipes are great. A whole chapter is dedicated to chocolate recipes -the chocolate pudding is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Perez

customer_reviews.title: Sad book.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Very poor quality and variety recipes. Spent too much words talking about what clean eating is and too little on real recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great Start to a New Life
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to finally have a succinct resource to explain the in’s and out’s of clean eating. This book is a great starter guide to launch this new lifestyle choice. There are so many scary things out there that people put into their bodies without realizing it. This book explains in great detail how to replace the unhealthy things in our lives with foods that will help to super charge our lives! The recipe section looks great! It is inspiring to read a book that sheds light on dirty foods that most people don’t even realize are bad for them!
customer_reviews.author: geneva l cagle

customer_reviews.title: Clean eating essentials
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect book for those that are seriously into weight training, endurance training, triathlons and the likes. Also, for beginners looking to maximize muscle mass as they train, following the recommendations in this book is key to achieving those results. However, it is essential to bear in mind that, it is not necessary to follow the advice to the latter, for the reason being one can become miserable in the process. Just do what works for you as an individual, while noting that no two people are alike when it comes to the results from both exercise and eating clean. Genetics plays a major role, but eating clean and healthy can improve your result drastically.
customer_reviews.author: SIA

customer_reviews.title: TLDR
customer_reviews.text: Cover wasn't good enough for me to read it, but I did buy it so it was good enough to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! While there are no pictures to show you what you are eating, the recipes sounds GREAT! PS ... I kinda like the idea of not showing pictures ... that way if it doesn't look like the photo at least I can judge it by taste! lol
customer_reviews.author: DeltaGal

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Blah recipes
customer_reviews.text: With a lot of these recipes they didn't have much seasoning. I made the peach cobbler and it was just oatmeal and peaches. Something where good like the soups. Still gonna try more just not impressed unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Book!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book for anyone that is wanting to start eating clean. It's very practical and realistic, with good tips on how to make clean eating work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great starter book!
customer_reviews.text: Great starter book! I am a health and fitness enthusiast so this book has been very useful in helping me with clients and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Camlin Lanee

customer_reviews.title: Easy Clean Eating
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook. It is not only easy to read and understand, it provides a great 14 day "kick start" plan to a healthier diet. The recipes are easy and work for my hectic lifestyle while providing tasty options for a cleaner meal. I have been using this book for a year now and I not only have a routine, I feel better. That is the most important part.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Hall

customer_reviews.title: Foods that cause histamine problems
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and the recipes and will be trying these recipes right away.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Leet

customer_reviews.title: I have the Kindle edition and I can't recommend it because finding individual recipes is challenging
customer_reviews.text: This is an informative, nicely-written book for anyone who wants advice about avoiding sugar, salt, white flour, and Kraft Mac and Cheese! As one who is gluten-free, and not by choice, I am acutely aware of what to avoid in the way of processed food. Other dietary restrictions will prevent me from following a number of the recipes, though there are some that I can make. I don't think I will do the clean tuna and noodle casserole, though. Too clean for me.I have the Kindle edition and I can't recommend it because finding individual recipes is challenging, at least on my Galaxy Tab, so buy the actual book.
customer_reviews.author: Lorac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have used many recipes from this book. They are quick and easy to make. I typically dont use a lot of recipes when i buy a cookbook, this cookbook however was well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good way to start
customer_reviews.text: This book is a good guide for those who want to start a Clean Eating lifestyle. It begins by defining what Clean Eating is and what the benefits are. After explaining the concepts, it gives you the steps to take in order to change the eating habits and start with a healthier way of life. The book gives recipes and tips on how to make the switch to Clean Eating. The most important part is that Clean Eating is not a diet, rather is a lifestyle, and changing what we eat rather than follow a diet that deprive your appetite is healthier than any diet.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A. Peña Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Worth reading cover to cover
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook encourages Clean Eating but does not condemn those who can’t or won’t go 100%. I liked that because it leaves options. It is not a diet, it is a way to change your shopping, eating and thinking about food in general. I liked that too because it means it won’t be another “diet” to fail. The glossary and references at the back of the book are very succinct and helpful. The ingredients, cooking methods and hints given were good and easy to follow. I made the Irish Bean and Cabbage Soup and was very happy with the results. All in all, worth the read and recipes are well worth having on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Monroe

customer_reviews.title: easy recipes. Just wish it had pictures
customer_reviews.text: Informative, easy recipes. Just wish it had pictures! I like to see what I am cooking. Liked the fact that the recipes had ingredients you could easily buy at a local market. Nothing extreme--coconut aminos anyone?
customer_reviews.author: CA Mom

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for diet planning
customer_reviews.text: A good resource on Clean Eating. I found this to be very useful in planning my diet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I woudn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the recipes carry over to the next page - very inconvenient! And there is no nutrition analysis for any of the recipes. I gave mine to Good Will,
customer_reviews.author: AndyAnne

customer_reviews.title: some are easy to follow some are chef style
customer_reviews.text: It's a recipe book, some are easy to follow some are chef style, I really don't know if the diet is something you can follow for life, but it's a nice book to have for healthy versions of some awesome meals.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: eating without effort.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of good things in this book. I'd recommend it for anyone concentrating on the day by day intake of foods that are supposed to be healthy yet pleasant to eat. KIt's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: frederick palmer

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: No nutritional info included with recipes. Potato with brocolli or squash soup is not sometjjng I consider to be lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Imelda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, extremely helpful must read book
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, informative, extremely helpful and I could go on. Great for beginners like me. Explains everything very well.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyM

customer_reviews.title: A Must Read
customer_reviews.text: This book is very informative and has some great recipes. I went right to the grocery store!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Practice makes perfect.
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful life we could have if we would eat this way and teach our children from infants to eat this way. We are eating way too much processed and fast food.
customer_reviews.author: Mary from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this! It isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth $.10, much less $10. A very small book (about 60 pages) with recipes that could've been crafted by a six-year-old.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Pick

customer_reviews.title: Keepin it Clean
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BOOK!!!! Clean eating is the way to go! I have made many recipes from the book. All recipes are really easy! That's what I love about it .... I'm one busy woman.... easy cooking is for me :)
customer_reviews.author: Shelle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Junger has made all the difference in the world to my eating habits!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great easy simple recipes...so you don't have to be intimated on how to cook clean...also very educational!
customer_reviews.author: cynthia chen

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: This book has some really good recipes. The only negative was several recipes called for canola oil. Even though the amount called for was small, canola oil is not good for you!
customer_reviews.author: Judi Jones

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes but I like photos and this book has none
customer_reviews.author: Chem

customer_reviews.title: ... a gift for a coworker who wanted to feel better. I looked through it before and it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a coworker who wanted to feel better. I looked through it before and it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great transaction!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the prompt eservice! Very pleased with my kindle purchase! Good enough to share with a friend, if I buy a hard copy!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Comer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good read, I love the recipes in here and try to keep with it!
customer_reviews.author: MSMJ Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: This has a lot of great recipe ideas and guidelines for planning a daily clean ...
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of great recipe ideas and guidelines for planning a daily clean eating plan. No pictures though which would have been nice!
customer_reviews.author: DDK3447

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes that are easy to make and are very nutritious. I just wish it had some pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this book.. Will be trying out some of the recipes, seem to be easy to make and flavorful...
customer_reviews.author: Terri Prather

customer_reviews.title: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to follow, The book describes everything we need to do and how to follow it. Going for it!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia King

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! I have made several recipes from it and continue to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgett Clark

customer_reviews.title: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet
customer_reviews.text: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet provides an extensive variety of nutritious recipes that you don’t want to miss. It explains the many health benefits of eating clean, which include everything from increased immunity and loss of body fat to just being in a better mood. The compelling arguments for improved well-being and the mouthwatering recipes had me wanting to switch to a clean eating diet tomorrow! From the Mediterranean Omelet for breakfast to the Plum Peach Sorbet for dessert, each one promised to be a delicious yet wholesome treat. Eating clean could be extremely beneficial. Whether you choose to try these recipes for this reason or just for something new, I promise you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Robust information!
customer_reviews.text: The Clean Eating Cookbook & Diet is filled with robust information shared in a conversational style, including the benefits of clean eating, recipes, description of common herbs/spices, and essential kitchen utensils. I was shocked by the figure "that the average North American consumes approximately 150 pounds of food additives a year by eating processed foods." Wow! While I appreciated how the book emphasized that a person doesn't have to practice clean eating 100% of the time (the author suggests ~80%), some remarks in the book went against that, i.e. "you should never eat refined sugar again." I wish the message stayed consistent throughout. Also, I wish there were pictures of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: tjgh

customer_reviews.title: Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: Some of the recipes are pretty decent but nothing to get too excited about. My big complaint is that the font style and size in the paperback is so difficult to read. I didn't find that in the "look inside" sample so it was strange when I received the book and found it so straining on the eyes. There are so many other clean eating books out there that are better. If you do get this one, I recommend Kindle as their font standards are all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Griffith

customer_reviews.title: ehh
customer_reviews.text: Definately better books out there. A lot of hard to find ingredients and recipes that I did not find appetizing.
customer_reviews.author: Jane K.

customer_reviews.title: I feel like "clean eating" should not equal "bland"
customer_reviews.text: I feel like "clean eating" should not equal "bland". You can eat healthy and avoid unnatrual sugars without losing flavor and only a couple of the recipes in this cookbook meet that standard. It's not a bad starting place for those that need quick, healthy meal options, but not the best cookbook out there.
customer_reviews.author: Coraline

customer_reviews.title: I love that the claims made in the book are backed ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous. I love that the claims made in the book are backed up by research. Definitely easy to follow too. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It has great sample diets and great recipes
customer_reviews.text: Very straight forward book. It has great sample diets and great recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Brown

customer_reviews.title: good menu long cook times
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cookbook, but it was not what i expected. There are good meals in here but it takes a long time to prepare and cook the food. This is how my mom use to cook. I don't have 40 to 60 minutes currently to cook food. Everything is so fast paced with two working parents and children in school with after school activities. It is hard to find time to cook that long. May use this in the future, but it's not right for me right now.
customer_reviews.author: cindy fenyus

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The book has some good recipes, but there are no pictures in it!
customer_reviews.author: sparkkplug8

customer_reviews.title: Good cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Made couple of the recipes and were good little bland. I am a picture and recipe kind of cook so wished there were pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Hether Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Super fast.
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped and arrived extremely fast. No issues. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: CChapman

customer_reviews.title: New way of thinking about diets.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of good information for those thinking of clean eating. I will certainly try some of the recipes. I'm looking forward to this new way of eating!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book contains tons of delicious recipes.. i recently turn to lean eating and this book has help me to cook several healthy diners.
customer_reviews.author: cinthya rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: The book is great and the turn around time is even better! I ordered it on a Friday and had it waiting for me the very next day!
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Chairez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Easy to understand. Very thorough. Interesting recipes and yummy recipes. Quick meals for one or two. Very good choice to buy
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle De Gange

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed flipping through, now starting over to read it, making notes also. Very good info. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Myrna Clark

customer_reviews.title: Clean eating books
customer_reviews.text: Recipes are easy to make just a good book to learn from and good tips for diet success a must have
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Information
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me and thinking about living a cleaner life, or at least eating cleaner then you’ll enjoy this book. The Clean Eating Cookbook offers simple and easy to understand instruction on how to incorporate clean eating principles into your daily routine. With precise information and clear language the authors specify which foods impart important nutrients and how clean eating preparation techniques maximize the health benefits. Then they go beyond that and include a fourteen day eating guide which illustrates how to implement clean eating. And finally and perhaps most importantly the book ends with over a hundred tasty recipes thus arming the reader to shop, cook and eat cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: dfp558

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. It has down to earth recipes. Easy and fun!! You can cook with ingredients from yout home.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Marin

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to substitute the quinoa for something like brown rice or wheat berries
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to follow this diet. I'm going to substitute the quinoa for something like brown rice or wheat berries. I had to get the book. I have it in audio and I was so impressed!
customer_reviews.author: kstars

customer_reviews.title: Boring Recipes, Search Clean Eating Online
customer_reviews.text: Nothing too special about this book. I loved it at first when I read it and though that it would be a great addition to my recipe ideas and eating plan. Then I went to use it....it's not as exciting as it looks and honestly, I've found much better and tastier recipes (not to mention creative) on line. I did the Buzzfeed Clean Eating Challenge and was a million times more impressed with the food usage, planning and delightful recipes than with this book. (I bought this in an effort to continue that challenge). I say google clean eating and find a plan - you will be happier that way.
customer_reviews.author: SPROUT

customer_reviews.title: X
customer_reviews.text: Item is as shown Transaction was seamless and shipping was right on
customer_reviews.author: Retired 2014

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying the new recipes, but really don't use often.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: It's No Playboy
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting complex recipes with far-fetched ingredients geared toward a Californian fitness guru. There was a little of that, but I was pleasantly surprised to also find recipes that were simplistic and appealing to families - like Honey Breakfast Cookies, Orange Cream Ice Pops, and Clean Tuna Noodle Casserole. My biggest gripe? NO pictures. A cookbook with no photos is like a Playboy with only articles. Sure, the articles are great, but... If you want to be enticed into a new eating lifestyle, this publishing house book probably will not motivate you for that. But if you have begun a clean eating regime and want some new recipes to try, this will deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The recipes look good. I haven't tried any of them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Gregg

customer_reviews.title: going to continue to search for good foods that are good for you but more palpable
customer_reviews.text: Not really my cup of tea, going to continue to search for good foods that are good for you but more palpable
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Nelson
